questions.questionText: Which of the following is a correct way to declare a variable in Python?
How do you declare and initialize a character variable in Java?
What symbol is used to assign a value to a variable in Python?
Which of the following is a valid variable name in Python?
Which keyword is used to declare an integer in Java?
How is a string variable declared and initialized in Python?
In Java, what is the correct way to declare multiple integer variables?
answerOptions: int a, String b, int c;

questions.questionText: What is the correct syntax to declare a float variable in Java?
Which of the following correctly initializes a list in Python?
What is the output of the following code: name = 'Alice'; print(name)?
Which type of variable is declared within a method in Java?
What is the default value of a String instance variable in Java?
Which of the following can be shared across all instances of a Java class?
Which of the following is a trait of instance variables in Java?
answerOptions: They are declared within a method.
They are shared among all instances of a class.
They are initialized with default values based on their type.
They can be accessed without creating an object.
questions.correctAnswer: They are initialized with default values based on their type.

questions.questionText: Which keyword is used to declare a static variable in Java?
Which type of variable exists only while a method is executing?
What is the primary difference between instance variables and static variables?
answerOptions: Instance variables belong to a class instance.
Static variables are declared inside methods.
Instance variables have a single copy.
questions.correctAnswer: Instance variables belong to a class instance.

questions.questionText: Which type of variable must be initialized before use in Java?
What is the output of the following code: int a = 5; System.out.println(a);?
What is a characteristic of static variables?
answerOptions: They can be declared in methods.
They are tied to a specific object.
They exist for the duration of the class.
They must be initialized at declaration.
questions.correctAnswer: They exist for the duration of the class.

questions.questionText: What is the scope of a local variable in Python?
answerOptions: Accessible inside the function it is declared in
questions.correctAnswer: Accessible inside the function it is declared in

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a global variable in Python?
answerOptions: A variable declared within a function
A variable declared outside any function
A variable declared with the 'nonlocal' keyword
questions.correctAnswer: A variable declared outside any function

questions.questionText: How can you modify a global variable inside a function in Python?
answerOptions: You cannot modify global variables inside a function

questions.questionText: What is the scope of a nonlocal variable in Python?
answerOptions: It is accessible in the global scope
It is accessible in the nested function scope
It is accessible throughout the entire module
It is a special type of instance variable
questions.correctAnswer: It is accessible in the nested function scope

questions.questionText: What will the following code output: global_var = 10; def my_func(): return global_var?
What is the default scope of a variable declared within a function in Python?
Which keyword is used to declare a variable with nonlocal scope?
How is a variable declared in Python?
What will the following code output: x = [1, 2, 3]; print(x[1])?
What is the output of the following code: y = 5; print(y + 2)?

title: Basics of Arrays in Java and Python

questions.questionText: What is an array?
answerOptions: A collection of elements of different types
A collection of elements of the same type
questions.correctAnswer: A collection of elements of the same type

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a valid declaration of a one-dimensional array in Java?
How do you create a list in Python?
What is the main difference between Java arrays and Python lists?
answerOptions: Java arrays can change size dynamically.
Python lists can store multiple data types.
questions.correctAnswer: Python lists can store multiple data types.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a valid declaration of a multidimensional array in Java?
How do you access the first element of a list in Python?
What keyword is used to create an array in Java?
Which of the following is true about Java arrays?
answerOptions: They can store elements of different data types.
They require an import statement to use.

questions.questionText: What module in Python can be used for creating arrays?
How do you create a 2D array in Python using lists?
Which method can be used to sort an array in Java?
How do you append an element to a list in Python?
What will `int[] arr = new int[5]` create in Java?
answerOptions: An array with 5 elements, all initialized to 0.
An array with 5 elements, all initialized to null.
An array with a length of 5, but no elements.
questions.correctAnswer: An array with 5 elements, all initialized to 0.

questions.questionText: Which of the following removes an element from a list in Python?
Which method in Java checks if two arrays are equal?

How do you reverse a list in Python?
What method can be used to copy an array in Java?
How do you check the type of elements in a Python array created with the array module?
What method returns the maximum value in a numpy array?

title: Advanced Topics and Comparison of Arrays

questions.questionText: What keyword is used to create a new array in Java?
Which of the following is true about Java arrays?
answerOptions: They can store elements of different data types.
They are declared with the 'list' keyword.

questions.questionText: In Python, what is the main advantage of using numpy arrays over lists?
answerOptions: Numpy arrays can store mixed data types.
Numpy arrays are faster and more memory-efficient for numerical operations.
questions.correctAnswer: Numpy arrays are faster and more memory-efficient for numerical operations.

questions.questionText: How can you create a 2D numpy array in Python?

What happens if you try to access an index out of range in an array in Java?

Which of the following correctly retrieves the last element from a Python list named 'my_list'?
In Python, how can you convert a list to a numpy array?
Which of the following statements is correct regarding array memory allocation in Java?
answerOptions: Memory is allocated at compile time.
Memory is allocated in the stack only.

questions.questionText: What is the result of 7 % 3 in both Python and Java?
In Python, what does 2 ** 3 return?
What is the output of 10 // 3 in Python?
Which operator performs multiplication in both Java and Python?
In Java, what is the result of 9 / 2?
Which of the following is the correct syntax for addition in Python?
What is the output of 10 % 3 in Java?
In Python, what is the result of 15 // 2?
What does the expression a += 2 mean in Java?
In Python, how do you perform exponentiation?
What is the result of 5 > 3 in Python?
Which operator checks if two values are equal in Java?
In Python, what does the 'and' operator do?
In Java, what is the output of true && false?
Which operator is used to check if two values are not equal in Python?
What is the result of 5 <= 5 in Java?
In Python, how would you check if 5 is greater than or equal to 2?
In Java, what does the '||' operator do?
Which operator is used for logical negation in Python?
In Java, what is the result of true || false?
Which operator performs bitwise AND in Java and Python?
In Python, what does the expression a //= 2 do?
answerOptions: Divides a by 2 and assigns the result to a
Divides a by 2 and assigns the quotient
questions.correctAnswer: Divides a by 2 and assigns the quotient

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the `instanceof` operator in Java?
answerOptions: Check if an object is an instance of a class
questions.correctAnswer: Check if an object is an instance of a class

questions.questionText: What is the result of 5 | 3 in Java?
In Python, what does the 'is' operator check?
What does the expression a %= 5 do in both Java and Python?
answerOptions: Assigns the modulus of a and 5 to a
questions.correctAnswer: Assigns the modulus of a and 5 to a

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a bitwise NOT operation in Java and Python?
In Python, what does 'in' operator check?
Which operator in Java is used for left shifting the bits of a number?
What does the expression a ^= b do in both Java and Python?
answerOptions: Performs bitwise XOR and assigns the result to a
Performs bitwise AND and assigns the result to a
questions.correctAnswer: Performs bitwise XOR and assigns the result to a

questions.questionText: What will the following code output: age = 18; if age >= 18: print('You are an adult.')?
What will the following code output: age = 16; if age >= 18: print('Adult'); else: print('Not an adult')?
What will the following code output: age = 20; if age < 18: print('Minor'); elif age < 65: print('Adult'); else: print('Senior')?
What will the following code output: age = 70; if age < 18: print('Minor'); elif age < 65: print('Adult'); else: print('Senior')?
In Java, what will the following code output: int age = 18; if (age >= 18) { System.out.println('You are an adult.'); }?
In Java, what will the following code output: int age = 16; if (age >= 18) { System.out.println('Adult'); } else { System.out.println('Not an adult'); }?
In Java, what will the following code output: int age = 20; if (age < 18) { System.out.println('Minor'); } else if (age < 65) { System.out.println('Adult'); } else { System.out.println('Senior'); }?
What is the purpose of an if-else statement?
answerOptions: To loop through a block of code
To execute code conditionally based on true or false
questions.correctAnswer: To execute code conditionally based on true or false

questions.questionText: What will the following Python code output: age = 19; if age < 18: print('Minor'); else: print('Adult')?
In Java, what will the following code output: int num = 5; if (num > 10) { System.out.println('Greater'); } else { System.out.println('Smaller'); }?
What will the following code output: age = 20; if age >= 18: if age < 21: print('Adult but not old enough to drink.')?
answerOptions: Adult but not old enough to drink.
questions.correctAnswer: Adult but not old enough to drink.

questions.questionText: What will the following code output: age = 22; if age >= 18: if age < 21: print('Adult but not old enough to drink.'); else: print('Adult and can drink.')?
answerOptions: Adult but not old enough to drink.

questions.questionText: What will the following code output: age = 16; if age >= 18: print('Adult'); elif age < 18: print('Minor')?

In Java, what will the following code output: int age = 20; if (age >= 18) { if (age < 21) { System.out.println('Adult but not old enough to drink.'); } else { System.out.println('Adult and can drink.'); } }?
answerOptions: Adult but not old enough to drink.
questions.correctAnswer: Adult but not old enough to drink.

questions.questionText: What will the following code output: age = 30; if age < 18: print('Minor'); elif age < 65: print('Adult'); else: print('Senior')?
What will the following code output: age = 70; if age < 18: print('Minor'); elif age < 65: print('Adult'); else: print('Senior')?
What is the result of using nested if statements?
What will the following Python code output: age = 21; if age < 18: print('Minor'); elif age < 21: print('Almost Adult'); else: print('Adult')?
In Java, what will the following code output: int num = 8; if (num % 2 == 0) { System.out.println('Even'); } else { System.out.println('Odd'); }?
What will the following code output: number = 7; if number < 10: print('Single digit'); else: print('Double digit')?
What will the following code output: temperature = 30; if temperature > 25: print('It's hot.'); else: print('It's cold.')?
In Java, what will the following code output: int score = 85; if (score >= 90) { System.out.println('A'); } else if (score >= 80) { System.out.println('B'); } else { System.out.println('C'); }?
What will the following code output: password = 'admin'; if password == 'admin': print('Access granted'); else: print('Access denied')?
In Java, what will the following code output: boolean isRaining = true; if (isRaining) { System.out.println('Take an umbrella.'); } else { System.out.println('No need for an umbrella.'); }?
What will the following code output: age = 10; if age < 13: print('Child'); elif age < 20: print('Teenager'); else: print('Adult')?
What will the following code output: speed = 70; if speed > 60: print('Over speed limit'); else: print('Within speed limit')?
In Java, what will the following code output: boolean isMember = false; if (isMember) { System.out.println('Welcome member!'); } else { System.out.println('Welcome guest!'); }?
What will the following code output: is_logged_in = False; if is_logged_in: print('Welcome back!'); else: print('Please log in.')?
What is the result of using if statements in programming?
answerOptions: Control the flow of the program based on conditions
questions.correctAnswer: Control the flow of the program based on conditions

questions.questionText: What will the following code output: number = 10; if number % 2 == 0: print('Even'); else: print('Odd')?
Which of the following is the correct syntax for a traditional for loop in Java?
How do you iterate over a list in Python?
What does the following loop do in Python? for i in range(3): print(i)
Which type of loop is best when you know the number of iterations in advance?
What keyword is used to skip the current iteration in a Python for loop?
What happens if a for loop condition in Java never becomes false?
answerOptions: The loop skips to the next condition

questions.questionText: In Python, how can you loop through both index and value of a list?
Which of the following is an example of a Java enhanced for loop?
Which of the following is the correct syntax for a while loop in Java?
In Python, what happens if the while condition never becomes False?
Which loop is best suited when the number of iterations is unknown?
In Python, how do you exit a while loop prematurely?
Which statement is true for both Java and Python while loops?
answerOptions: The loop body runs at least once
The loop checks the condition before running the body
The condition is checked after the loop body executes
You cannot break out of a while loop
questions.correctAnswer: The loop checks the condition before running the body

questions.questionText: In Java, what is the difference between while and do-while loops?
answerOptions: do-while loop checks the condition before executing the body
while loop always runs at least once
do-while loop executes the body before checking the condition
questions.correctAnswer: do-while loop executes the body before checking the condition

questions.questionText: What will happen if a while loop's condition is initially False in Java?
answerOptions: The loop runs at least once
The loop will not run at all
questions.correctAnswer: The loop will not run at all

questions.questionText: Which keyword is used to immediately exit a loop in both Python and Java?
What is the key difference between a while loop and a do-while loop in Java?
answerOptions: while loop executes at least once
do-while loop checks the condition before running
do-while loop executes at least once
questions.correctAnswer: do-while loop executes at least once

questions.questionText: What is the correct syntax for a do-while loop in Java?
Which of the following is true for a Python loop?
answerOptions: Python supports only while and for loops
Python loops always run at least once
questions.correctAnswer: Python supports only while and for loops

questions.questionText: Which loop type guarantees at least one iteration?
How does a do-while loop differ from a for loop?
answerOptions: The do-while loop guarantees one execution before checking condition
A for loop does not allow conditions
A for loop checks the condition after execution
questions.correctAnswer: The do-while loop guarantees one execution before checking condition

questions.questionText: Which Java loop executes the block at least once before checking the condition?
In Python, which loop type checks the condition first?
Can a do-while loop be used in Python?
answerOptions: Yes, by using a 'while True' construct
No, Python does not support do-while loops
Yes, but only in newer versions
questions.correctAnswer: No, Python does not support do-while loops
